Lately and especially tonight, the wheels seem to be coming off. The kitchen lacked an executive chef and was a skeleton crew of young, eager and hardworking sous chefs. One man on sate', one salad prep and one other misc pair of hands. 

I ordered the Cioppino and the wife 1/2 crab sauté in garlic and butter. We were sitting at the bar so I had a birds eye view of the kitchen. I watched as my dish was basically completed and set on the back burner as my wife's dish was behind in the order of things. It sat there for 15 minutes at least. The dish looked and tasted thrown together. Crab was robbed of any sweetness and prawns were dry and mealy. Remaining stew was a little bitter. 

The crab dish, having been cooked and served in the proper order had a better balance of flavors. 

The two waitresses were overwhelmed and service was lacking. No busboy on staff. The check was set down before our plates were cleared. 

I don't fault a single person there as all we're doing the best they could, but the result was less than stellar. 

Hang in there Red Hill Station.
author: Tony t.

description: Small place with a lot of heart. Our server was Carlos. He was awesome! Food was excellent. My hubby, kids and I walked in off the street on a Tuesday evening and were immediately sat in the private room! I had the basil roasted almond pesto with prawns! Food came out quickly and was full of flavor! I would come back again in a heartbeat!
author: Amy H.

description:
I come here once a week for lunch. I love the calamari salad and linguini dishes.
Food is good and fresh. Service is nice and friendly. Lovely neighborhood. I always find parking near by.
author: Missy W.

description:
I've eaten at RHS twice since their recent opening and it's been consistently mouth-watering across the board.

Bernal Heights is lucky to have these guys in the hood, and judging by the fact that it is packed in there every time I walk by, they're here to stay.

You can easily make a reservation on their website, which I highly recommend. Service and atmosphere are really fantastic. You get that warm neighborhood vibe the moment you step inside and despite being busy, the servers are more than happy to chat with you about the specifics of any of the dishes.

All the seafood is top top shelf, so its totally worth channeling that couple from "Portlandia" and asking where a specific item comes from (asking for your fish's name might be pushing it but that's up to you). It's nice to know that there is thought and intention put into sourcing the highest quality ingredients.

That same attention to detail was evident in the preparation of every dish I've had there as well. The menu changes daily, so trip number two ended up being just as exciting as the first time.

One item I hope is always on the menu (I had it both times) is the fried anchovies with pesto. Seriously. So. Good...

Other than that, the oysters are an obvious hit, as well as the pasta/seafood dishes. The one I had recently was a linguine with clams, muscles and tuna. Yes please more please.

All in all it's everything I love about dining out -- thoughtful, delicious food and warm, welcoming service.

I will definitely be back again. And again. (And again.)
author: Dan T.

description: I love this place . I can eat here every day. I love the calamari salad, seafood pasta and everything else. I love the location and usually you don't have to wait for hours to get a table.
author: Sal R.

description:
I found this place on yelp and was intrigued because of the high reviews. I was in the mood for seafood and in the spirit of making me happy my boyfriend agreed to come here.

We made a reservation on open table and were seated after a couple minutes of waiting. We ordered the oysters on the half shell, and shared the bay shrimp Caesar salad as appetizers and they were awesome! Although they could do us a favor by bringing out the Caesar salad cut up (it's pretty inconvenient cutting up whole romaine lettuce leaves covered in slippery Caesar dressing), it was tasty and we devoured it all.

The problem I had was when it came to the entrees. My boyfriend ordered the fish and chips, and I ordered the king salmon. One big problem - MY FOOD NEVER CAME. Like ever. Once my boyfriend got his food, the waiter told me mine would be out shortly. So I was patient. Then he came back and said that my food was getting plated, 15 minutes later. Although I told my boyfriend to eat, he was hesitant to do so because I didn't have my food - and it was my idea to come here! I started getting LIVID and come to find out that my food was plated for a to-go order, and was not even close to being ready.

We were planning to go out after, as it was a Saturday night and when they asked me if I wanted the order to-go, I said no. The moment had passed, and our date was ruined! 

However, they acknowledged their mistake and comped the entire meal, which was very gracious. I don't know what went on in the kitchen, but the table next to us let us know that it's not typical of this establishment and urged us to give it another try. We left a tip for the nice waiter and the fact that they didn't hesitate to comp, but I'd much rather spend my money somewhere knowing I'll actually get a plate of food.
author: Jasmine H.

description:
An outstanding addition to Bernal Heights.  I had the pleasure of having lunch there earlier today.

The amuse bouche consisted of a few olives in a warmed lemon - olive oil with minced capers and anchovies.  Absolutely delicious.  The bread was a yeasty, whole-wheat bread with a perfect crumb and crust.  
I had the Caesar Salad with Grilled Calamari.  It was the best salad, let alone caesar salad, I have had in my life.  The lemony-garlic olive oil dressing was perfect - the calamari was grilled amazingly tender - the romaine perfectly crisp - and the crumpled croutons a lovely touch.
Delightful and helpful staff.
After leaving was queried on the street about my experience and I raved about my meal.  I had to return shortly to pick up something left behind and saw the person lunching contentedly on Linguine Vongole.  Definitely spread the word!
author: Terry A.

description:
My older son had a school activity in this neighborhood and that's how we ended up in this restaurant. I ordered the clam linguine which was delicious! They were very generous with their clams and the taste totally hit the spot. The mister ordered the fish and steak tacos. I didn't find that mix well. I really shouldn't even give that dish a review since I only took a bite. Did I mention my clam linguine was divine? They also have a kids' menu!
Anyway, the complimentary bread (served with olive oil and basalmic) and olives were a big bonus. The bread was super fresh. It helped calm us down a bit when we had to wait 35 minutes for the food to come. That's why I took away the star because the loooong wait. The service was friendly. After a while, our server wasn't as welcoming as he came to us 3 times to let us know our food is almost ready...and almost ready...and almost here, but it didn't come until 35 minutes later. After a while, I started to get annoyed because the wait was absurd. What was weird was the table who sat down 15 mins later, got the food the same time we did. 
Besides the long wait for the food (but since it was good, I won't complain too much), everything about this place was great.
author: Em T.

description: What a great find!  Fish n chips and a burger were the best we've ever had.  Fresh, tasty and a fabulous environment!  We are soooo coming back again !
author: Josie M.

description:
I finally got to try Red Hill Station and it did not disappoint.

I went with three of my friends so that we could try a little bit of everything.

When we first got there our table was not ready so they took my phone number and told us that they would call us when it was ready and that because of our wait we would get a drink on them. Love the proactive way of addressing the issue and it wasn't even their fault the table wasn't ready, the people that had it before us were gabbing away and took longer then expected.

Honestly at this moment I forgot exactly what we had but we ended up ordering two appetizers (oysters on the half shell and fried anchovies), entrees (2 fish dishes and 2 pasta dishes), and two desserts plus we went through two bottles of wine and an extra glass of draft wine while we were waiting for our second bottle to chill.

Everything was delicious, the food was timely, the service was pleasant, though it did take a bit to get our glasses refilled (wine and water). But overall it was a fabulous dinner.
author: PaPai X. T.

description: A great addition to Bernal Heights. The seafood is fresh and prepared perfectly. The oysters selection were terrific.
author: Robert O.

description:
Not sure why Susan B gave it four stars before trashing the fish and chips! My girlfriend ate there and, knowing her British boyfriends love of his national dish, took me there the next weekend. Her son and his pal came along; the friend could barely eat the fish! The "chips" (French fries; too skinny to be called chips) were overcooked and lacked flavour. The fish was I a very greasy batter.
Absolutely no way she and I will ever eat here again, which is too bad because its in her 'hood (Bernal Heights)
author: Michael A.

description:
Such fresh oysters - and the sauce that come with it makes them so amazing! 

Came here for a late lunch with husband and our little toddler. We made a reservation but ended up getting there early. The place is small with about 8 tables at the most. Luckily it wasn't full so they were able to accommodate even though we were early. 

I ordered the crab roll and it was very good. The salad was very fresh too. Husband ordered the calamari salad and it was very fresh and not overpowering with any strong flavors. 

Minus one star because some of the mason jars they use for water cups were not clean..  And the food is on the pricier side.
author: Sera P.

description: Interesting concept of food - seafood more in particular. Enjoyed almost everything! We had shrimp cocktail, baked sea bass, beef bourguignon and pasta with bacon. Delicious! It will be great if the restaurant can be more creative with the naming of the dishes because they are quite different from what people have in mind about beef bourguignon or shrimp cocktail.
author: Yina M.

description:
Came here during the day and it wasn't very busy. We started with the monterey calamari salad and caesar salad. The salads were fresh and the calamari was perfectly grilled, where the calamari is still tender and juicy with a hint of smoke. Then we went onto the cioppino, crab sandwich, manila clam linguine, and fish and chips. I really enjoyed the cioppino and linguine. They're loaded with flavor and ingredients. I slopped up the sauce with the table bread. We even had to ask for more bread. The crab sandwich was also loaded with crab and the bread was soft and a little toasted.
I do agree the service was slow. It was basically just 2 people for this small area, but half the time they were missing.
author: Stephanie Y.

description:
If I was one of the the raters at Michelin, and found myself in the outer limits of downtown San Francisco (ie, Bernal Heights), Red Hill Station and its chef, Taylor Pedersen, would wind up with a star or two. It's that good.

Three of us went there to celebrate a birthday, and we walked away totally amazed and satisfied with the experience: the food, the wine, the ambiance, the service (Aura is lovely and wonderful!) was perfect. From the raw oyster tray to the marinated anchovies to the Ceasar salad, to the grilled calamari, sand dabs special, and oyster pot pie (in an amazing broth!) it was superb.

In addition because it was a birthday, the celebrant was presented with desert gratis. A lovely touch. We'll all be back over and over again.
author: Jeff B.

description: Great time with 4 friends catching up. Super cozy little spot with excellent seafood and wine on tap. We were floored by the excellent mussels w/ chorizo -- scooping the broth up with bread till the last drop. The calamari salad is also an extra entree. Absolutely required eating in Bernal!
author: J M.

description: The place is not that big, so it is better to make reservation. I love the salmon appetizer , and the creamy pasta is also good.
author: Bonnie Y.

description: Don't read into the four stars, this is as good a restaurant as you can find - inventive and delicious cuisine, attentive and personal service, great ambience, cozy, everything works, and a destination if you love seafood. The highlight for me what is perhaps a misnamed "oyster pot pie" -- I would go back just for this: a smooth, creamy chowder of oysters and potatoes topped with a delicate pastry puff with caramelized bacon and micro greens. The calamari salad with roasted figs, peppers and summer squash is also a winner. Don't leave without sampling their pot de creme for dessert - simple and yummy. What a great find!
author: Albert K.

description:
What an amazing new gem in our neighborhood! Fresh bright flavors in a seafood-centric menu! 
We can't wait to go back!
author: elisa g.

description:
Red Hill Station is a pain for me to get to.  Starting from the Presidio, I might as well be going to Napa or the East Bay considering travel time.  But never mind that, the place is popular with locals as person after person who came in was known to and received a hug from the chef.  My server was OK, and that is something considering that the place is relatively new.

I started with a Caesar salad with bay shrimp.  One thing that the restaurant should clarify on the menu is that there is a surcharge for the shrimp.  Nevertheless, the serving size was huge, the romaine and shrimp were fresh, and while at first blush I thought the dressing was going to be too oily, it was pretty much spot on.  A very good plate of food.

An appetizer of sausage meatballs was nice enough.  What made the dish was the bright tomato sauce that surrounded the meatballs.  While the meatballs were obviously house made they were overshadowed by the fresh sauce.  

My main of fish and chips was a case of too much of a pretty good thing.  The potato sticks were a bit overcooked and somewhat hard to get from the bowl to my mouth.  The black cod was obviously fresh but played second fiddle to a coating of perfectly fried crust that was a bit too ample.  The crust could also have used just a bit of seasoning.  The slaw that came with the fish was akin to sauerkraut but wasn't sufficiently astringent to go with the fried food.

I should comment that my salad and main would have constituted a very ample meal by themselves.  So be aware that Red Hill Station is very generous with their portioning.
author: David D.

description:
- food: quality ingredients that tasted fresh
- atmosphere: cozy but comfortable
- staff: very accommodating but slow service
- price: a little pricey, but good-sized portions

additional info:
- bring a bigger group for the party room that has a window to the kitchen and its own Sonos
- several good options on the kids menu
author: J. B.

description:
Where do I start! This place is one of the best. I have eaten here several times with different groups and on a date and each time I left so satisfied. 

I really love their space in the corner for larger groups. Plus could the owners be any nicer?!
author: Jourdain D.

description: Great neighborhood seafood restaurant with a few plates suitable for vegetarians all creatively presented and full of fresh delicious ingredients. Had the Candy Cap Mushroom Creme Brûlée was tasty and unique dish great service will definitely be coming back!!!!
author: Maria R.

description:
Fabulous food, and even better service.
I've dined at red hill twice in the last month, once for lunch and once for dinner.
Lunch was delicious, service was good.
Dinner was super yummy and the service (I think our server's name was chris) was superb. Chris dealt with my less-than-pleasant child like a fricken saint, bless him!
The super yummy food is high on flavor and seasoning--not bland/ subtle fare. 
Great neighborhoody spot for a good meal.
author: Rahna B.

description: I really enjoyed their Caprese salad. I had a pasta from here that was also very good. Everything was fresh and delicious.
author: Sheena B.

description: fantastic food, friendly staff, nice place. All the fish pastas are great. Fish Tacos are also great. Oysters. Salads. If you like fish I know very few other places in SF that will make you equally happy.
author: Fred A.

description: I've been here multiple times and had an excellent meal every time. Food is to die for and staff is excellent. Highly recommend!
author: Jennifer B.

description: Such a lovely restaurant. I enjoyed the food, the ambiance, and the waitstaff. I went for my birthday dinner at a friends referral. I had oysters, garlicy lemony pasta with clams, and a lovely glass of wine. My friend had a lovely dish of trout with grilled vegetables. OH and we had the pot de creme for dessert which was fantastic. A+
author: Dana H.

description: I've had dinner here once before and enjoyed it very much. We ordered oysters on the half shell to start. They were fresh and delicious and reasonably priced at $2.50 each. We shared the calamari salad, also very fresh, beautifully played and cooked. I ordered the whole fish, this evening broiled mackerel, unfortunately the fish was over cooked and dry. Service was knowledgeable, friendly and well versed about the menu
author: Monika F.

description: Congrats Amy, just watched the reviews from Check Please, everything they said is true. You have a great place and we love that we live up the street from you. Love the crab sauté. Thank you again. Joy/Frankie.
author: Joy P.

description: Really enjoyed dinner here last night. Had one of the most delicious ciopinnos that I have ever had. All the seafood was cooked perfectly and the broth was rich in flavor. I sipped every last drop. Very affordable dinner for two. Definitely coming back to try more dishes.
author: Don M.

description: Great food! Happy to see this place open in bernal. We visited on opening day and enjoyed the shrimp salad and salmon. We'll be back for sure.
author: Michael C.

description: Everything was very fresh. It tasted like they made things fresh from their garden. We will definitely be back.
author: Paul D.

description:
My dinner at Red Hill Station last evening was delicious!
Everything was incredibly fresh .  Our group tasted many things, anchovies, oysters, clams, Cesar salad, pasta, we were happy with everything.  The chef's choices of flavors are simultaneously exciting and comforting.  The decor is elegant and the staff is friendly and helpful.   I will be back often.  
I wish I could give it 10 stars!
author: Ena D.

description: Best food I've had in a long time! Service wasn't super fast, but I prefer it that way, I personally don't like feeling like I'm being rushed to order, eat and leave as soon as I finish. We ordered mussels in wine sauce and Caesar salad for appetizers, both were great and big enough to share between 5 of us. We all got something different for our main course. Calamari salad, mackerel, trout and cod. All dishes had beautiful presentation, and all were delicious. If I had to rank them trout was the best. We finished with desserts and tea. We got one of each and were not disappointed, everything was delicious, but Zabaione was something out of this world entirely. Will definitely be back for more.
author: Lotta F.

description: The anchovies are delicious and they came with a pesto sauce on the side and a delicious little green salad. The fish and chips came with copious amounts of slender (sometimes soggy) fries. I was quite happy with my fish until I noticed that my neighbor had three pieces instead of my two. However it was very, very fresh and the batter was excellent. The service was OK. The bus person took care of us while the waiter came in at the end to ensure that our meal was good. We had to wait for our entrees because every table ordered at once. That was fine to know. It's OK to wait if you are given a head's up. However, I got my fish and chips about five minutes before the baked fish. I didn't like that part. I would definitely return to check out something that's not deep fried. It all smelled wonderful.
author: Susan B.

description: Really terrific dining experience.  Every dish was either really good or outstanding.  No disappointments.  The carbonara linguine was a standout. Mussels were among the best I've had. Beer and wine on tap at good prices.  Overall value was excellent.  Cute place, great service.  Big hit. Will be back!
author: James S.

description: We went here for breakfast. 3 of us had eggs in cocoette (which we had been told was amazing). All 3 turned out very different. Mine was good and very liquidy (which I think is how it's supposed to be), another was drier and the third was completely dry.  It was also supposed to have candied bacon which none of them had. I was fine with it but my friend was disappointed. Overall, I'd definitely go back. Hopefully they were having an off day.
author: Nicole S.

description: The food is all fresh, unique, beautifully presented and the staff is very welcoming and helpful.
author: Alison S.

description: Very very nice sea food dishes! We had shrimp melt, beer battered cod & chips, & a wonderfully tender grilled calamari Cesar salad. Will be back again for sure!
author: Amen C.

description: Love the food here. Such a cute and romantic restaurant. Call ahead to get your name on a wait list.
author: Natalia A.

description:
We reserve on OpenTable for Saturday 7:30 PM. We show up 7:46PM.

Waiter sees us and after a few minutes welcomes us. Goes to the back (reminiscence of car dealership, hmmmm) to talk with the boss. Comes back to tell us that they gave the table away after 15 min. Which is a lie because the folks at what should have been our table were comfortably seated with filled glasses when we arrived.

We asked if they called us. Nope. Not "No sorry" just "No". 

Then Mr. Waiter tells us it will be "just  few minutes". So we wait a few minutes. Did I mention that we were there with our 5-yr old who was getting really hungry by then? A few minutes passed. We ask again. Mr. waiter talks to Mme. Boss. Now, Mme Boss comes over (we are close to sealing the deal!). Tells us they don't call when folks are late. Clear attitude telling us "I am the Boss, my way or the Freeway". Now it will be 15 minutes: look at this table, the people are "almost finished". Riiiight, like they are not in the middle of enjoying their desert having a fine time and wanting to extend said fine time.

Dear Red Hill, You could cook the most amazing food on the planet but with that attitude, you won't get my business. You need to call before giving a table away. That is what every restaurant does.

Bad place for kids BTW.
author: NoName M.

description: Delicious lunch at Red Hill Station today.  The seafood was fresh and delicious and the vinaigrette on the salads was marvelous.  But what we hoped would be a quick lunch turned into an ordeal when it took over 40 minutes to get our meal! And we were the first and only customers in the door at noon.  Go for the food, but go when you have plenty of time to spare.
author: Donna L.

description: Disappointing. We checked in just before 7pm on a Friday evening and were told they would text to let us know our table was ready in about 40 mins. No problem, we say! Went down the street to the wine bar (great!) and about 50 mins later (7.50pm) noticed no text message. We were on a schedule due to childcare so the hubby popped back down only to find out the hostess had messed up. A table was given to us then promptly taken away because another guest kicked off due to the same situation. Needless to say 15 mins later (8.05pm) we got our table. Offered free glass of wine, which was a nice gesture. Before we ordered we told the waiter we needed to be gone by just after 9.00 - sure no problem, they say. Our dinner finally arrived at 8.45pm. Burger (so small it was more bun than burger) and fish and chips which were meh. Definitely not worth the wait!! Not sure we'll give it another try.... It may just have been an off night for their hostess which impacted the kitchen, but ultimately left us feeling rushed and dissatisfied with our meal and overall experience.
author: Denise P.

description: Food and service was excellent,  prices too steep for what it is. Fish was so fresh got the fish tacos and fish  and chips, also a bottle of wine.  The 2 dishes over $20 each, it's should be $15.
author: Karen T.

description: Not the Best Fish-n-Chips I've ever had in my life. Don't get me wrong; I was hoping they would be the Best Fish-n-Chips I've ever had. A friend told me they would be. Oddly, everything else went according to plan: not a problem parking nearby, waitstaff and other patrons were delightful, the mushroom creme brulee was very tasty. My two dining companions and I put all our eggs in one basket and ordered the fish-n-chips all around. Wish we had been a bit more creative and shared multiple dishes, as there are several other things on the menu that I'd like to try in the future.
author: Rick P.

description: Delicious, fresh, high quality seafood!   Pleasant, friendly staff and a light and airy atmosphere.  Already thinking about my next visit.  I had the cod tacos.  The plate comes with THREE generous tacos filled with perfectly cooked cod, a yummy red cabbage slaw and crema.  A lovely green salad with a honey balsamic dressing with beets, peas and radishes on the side.  My coworker had the calamari salad and loved it so much, he told the chef personally.  yum yum!
author: Sarah F.

description:
We had the chef Taylor put together a sort of tasting menu for our table, and each dish was excellent. Words can't do our meal justice. Service was amazing too. The chef highlights seafood, with a modern creative twist.
We started with a tuna tartar, the best I've ever had -- the tuna fresh and buttery, the seasoning savory, pungent and delicious.
We then shared a caeser salad, followed by mussels in a lime cream broth with chorizo. Our final seafood dish was a very buttery local sea bass I believe. The wines we tried were interesting as well. Don't miss dessert at this restaurant either! The candy cap creme brulee, chocolate pot de creme, and funnel cake believe it or not, were absolutely delicious. Nothing was left on our plates, and not because the portions were small! (We took a long walk around Bernal afterwards as a digestive.) We are lucky to live in a city with such choices and such talented chefs, but this place is really special. I don't live in this neighborhood, but I'll be back.
author: Meredith G.

description: Go here, it's amazing.  We wandered in early one evening and weren't sure what to expect.  The staff was friendly and then the food came and it was delicious.  We had some oysters which which some of the best I've had (better than Zuni, yup I said it.) and then I departed from the seafood theme and had a great chicken dish as a main.  The wine selection was limited but excellent.  The best part was when the bill came, very reasonable dinner out for that level of quality and service.  Although I had been lamenting the loss of Liberty Cafe to the neighborhood, I found a much better repacement.
author: Ava M.

description:
My wife and I made a trip out here. I have never been to the Bernal Heights area. In my younger days, I would always pass by on the 14 Mission bus and I always wondered what was on that east side of Mission Street. We ended up parking in the neighborhood since there was a bunch of construction zones on Cortland. They have some small one lane streets that are two way to traffic in Bernal Heights. On Courtland Street, the neighborhood businesses seem untouched by time. It reminded me of Mission Street and Geneva Ave about twenty years ago. 
The service was pretty good at Red Hill.  I had the steelhead trout for lunch. The trout was great. It had a slight burnt flavor on some bites but I think that was the way it was supposed to be. Usually the sides, vegetable and sometimes the potatoes are an afterthought. But the vegetable were great as was the potatoes.
My wife got the pot pie sampler, which consisted of a mini oyster pot pie, beef pot pie and clam pot pie. The oyster turned out to be the tastiest followed by the oyster and then the beef. If you get the pot pie, I would say go for the sampler. I think it called Pot Pie Flight. The waitress pointed the sampler to my wife and we are glad that she did.
As I walked back to the car on the hill, I could see Lowes on Bayshore Blvd. Give this place try. It is tucked away in a neighborhood that is still untouched by time.
author: Cat F.

description: Trout and tuna tartare was so good!  Oh my gosh!  I ordered another bit of the trout for my take-home meal!  Was delicious with the crostini bread!  This place is gggrrrreat!  I had the pasta pomodora  for dinner, no regrets although the trip home took way too long and I finished the trout quickly as possible.  I was very satisfied!
author: Katrina R.

description:
Four of us are at red hill last night. For starters, we ordered the big carafe of wine. While it's pretty overpriced, at $50, it beat buying wine by the glass. The big carafe should have been priced at about $35-40! 
We ordered 12 oysters. They were super fresh. The sweetwaters were superb, while the other variety was totally flavorless. Strongly recommend that you try one of each variety before placing a larger order. The cippino was quite lovely, but remarkably void of much fish or crab. It's a large pan of tomato sauce with minor amounts of fish. Luckily, You can easily fillup on good bread. Nice, small portions for the price, and beware inconsistency in the fresh oysters
author: Geoff R.

description: Still lusting after their preparation of calamari nearly a week later - it's going to be hard to match that in my new hometown. Their other preparations of fish have also been very creative and delicious. They immediately showed up with crayons and a coloring book when my wife and I came with our daughter, and squeezed us in for a quick meal, in spite of an upcoming reservation. Ignore the silly review that says they're too friendly - one of the joys of coming to restaurants in Bernal is the friendly small-town feel in big SF. And an extra star for holding on to my credit card for several days after I'd forgotten it there - thanks so much!
author: Chris K.

description: Red Hill station!! What can I say?  The best meal of the trip. Started with 5 different varieties of oysters and clams to boot. Then came the steamed mussels in cream and chili broth!! WOW. The Caesar salad with Creek shrimp was stellar with light dressing and crunchy lettuce. The fresh fresh fresh Ah I tar tar was delectable.  My entree was the linguini with mussels and clams in white wine and tarragon!!! The house red wine warmed the heart as well as delighting the pallette. What a feast!! Finished with an incredible chocolate pot De creme!! It's worth the trip from anywhere . Always fresh new menu daily. Taylor is at the top of his craft. The staff fully knowledgeable.  Did not want to leave
author: Poggi P.

description:
Oh, Red Hill Station. I wanted to like you, I really did. You're so close and convenient! I heard such good things! But my cod was merely passable, not remarkable, and the experience was ruined by two things:

(1) Being seated right next to a glass door that sticks - which customers would, naturally, open every two minutes and blast me with the chilly evening Bernal winds and leave ajar, never noticing, forcing me to close it again and again so I didn't freeze.

(2) The positively ear-splitting volume, which is already common enough in SF restaurants (and some customers are getting quite sick of that, thank you), but which was even more pronounced here, and augmented by the boisterous talk of other tables and the frequent CLANG of utensils being thrown in the kitchen, effectively making conversation impossible.

I might give you another chance when you fix that door. Seriously. That really ruined the whole night.
author: Bill P.

description: Atmosphere and food were both fantastic. I definitely recommend this place.
author: Melanie B.

description: I love this place , the food , the people and staff . I can not wait to come back again soon .
author: Matthew K.

description:
Red Hill is the new "hot" addition to the neighborhood, and after finally getting a reservation and going in for dinner a few days ago, I can understand why. The food gets 5 stars, but they lose one star because the service was a bit spotty. Everything we ate was delicious -- especially the calamari salad, linguine with pesto, and the steamed mussels + clams + pork belly. The calamari salad was a great, surprising combination of calamari, arugula, and roasted figs. The broth in the mussels + clams + pork belly dish was some of the best I've ever had in a dish like that, and it went really well with the crusty bread they brought. We also started with oysters, which tasted very fresh. The Calm Cove oysters from Washington were HUGE!

However, there were a couple of periods during the meal where we had trouble getting our server's attention, such as when we wanted to order more drinks and at the end of the meal when we couldn't get the check and then when we couldn't get her to take our credit card for awhile. I thought the pacing was a little bit off, as we waited a long time between our appetizers and our entrees, and our waitress forgot the side of french fries we ordered. By the time we realized that they were not coming, we were too far into our entrees to remind her. It didn't show up on the bill, so I'm assuming she forgot. She repeated our order to us when we ordered, but she didn't write anything down when she took our order -- that was sort of a bummer. I'll definitely give them a pass on the service issues since they're so new, especially since the food was so good. I look forward to going back again once I can get another table!
author: Pilan C.

description: Great neighborhood place for lunch or dinner! We celebrated my dad's bday and were so happy to see oyster pot pie on the menu -his favorite!  All the pot pies were so tasty and the crust was tender and flaky. The only one that didn't hit the mark was the pulled pork since it was more of an Asian curry flavor and the anise was too strong. The calamari salad was delicious and my mom enjoyed the lamb shank. When both parents are happy with their meals, we know the restaurant is a keeper!  Service was excellent as well!
author: tina l.

description: Was driving through Bernal Heights and found this place on Yelp. What a great find. The four of us all immensely enjoyed our meals. I had three different varieties of oysters for an appetizer followed by steamed clams in white wine with tomatoes. My partners in crime had: hangar steak & prawns, the cod dish and shrimp/avocado salad (we also had a uniquely boozy tiramisu for desert). All were delicious. Can't recommend this neighborhood gourmet gem enough.
author: Bob L.

description:
Six of us went to Red Hill Station this weekend and sat in the little room above the kitchen. It was a perfect spot to get the vibe of the restaurant without too much noise. 
And the food was incrediblel!  We started with a platter of oysters which were super fresh, followed by  fried smelt and tuna tartare, both of which were perfectly done and served. The tuna tartare, in particularly, had an amazing dipping sauce. The main courses were just as fresh and delicious.  My ling cod tacos were tasty as could be and came with an arugula salad.  One of our party had the short ribs and that was also cooked to perfection. So Taylor, the chef, can do more than just seafood.  They do it all very, very well. I'm not a big dessert person, but the funnel cake is pretty special, not too sweet and melts in your mouth. One last note: the portions are generous and you leave feeling very well satisfied at this amazing new restaurant in Bernal.
author: Suhl C.

description:
My friend and I tried Red Hill Station for brunch after hearing good reviews from a bartender at the Latin America Club. 

The brunch menu is fairly small but you can also order lunch if you want. We asked the server what her favorites were and we ordered French Toast and Eggs en Cocette. 
Both were great but the French Toast was fantastic, it might be the best I've ever had. Truly delicious. Service was professional and friendly. The prices are higher than most brunch spots but are reasonable for the excellent food. 

I'll definitely be back to try lunch and dinner. This is a great addition to Bernal.
author: John W.

description: It was our friend's birthday and there were 8 of us. We ordered almost everything on the menu. The linguini vongole, my favorite dish, was a hit. Other yummy dishes were the calamari salad and mussel. Definitely, I will come back to try other dishes.
author: Meo M.

description:
My bf and I had dinner here on what was, I believe, still their soft opening. It was terrific! We got there after 9 (had done happy hour in the Castro with friends that went a little later than we thought it would). 
We were greeted warmly at the door by Tamara (I hope that was her name!). While we waited for a table she poured us two glasses of a crisp, tasty white wine and chatted us up about the new restaurant. 
We got a table quickly and though the menu was slim-- it only had two entrees-- it looked creative and inventive. Unfort they were out of the trout but we ordered the tuna carpaccio which was a nicely generous portion and delish. The ceasar-- oh my stars-- heavenly. A heaping pile of seasoned bay shrimp in top! I'll be back just for that alone. Since there was no trout our only option was the skirt steak with baby carrots and small potatoes. Again another winner and large portion. 
I have to say, it might have been a soft opening but they woo'd us pretty hard. Friendly and warm and delicious. And btw the chef/owner is quite dashing. I can't wait to see how they evolve from here!
author: Rob W.

description: I admit to using forgoing the eateries in my neighborhood - like for the last 15 years, ThenRed Hill Station comes along to change my mind, I at tented a private event there and dreaded a canned meal. Surprise!nMy salmon was expertly prepared (as in not overcooked) and served with forbidden rice and delicious miso flavors. Oyster were ultra fresh, Wine on tap program is solid. The service was stellar and I cannot wait to come back - am now going to contact them about hosting my own private event there.
author: CJ C.

description: Super cute neighborhood restaurant.  Our waiter was super great.  The food was superb!  Everything we ordered was out of this world.  If I could have gotten away with licking my plate, I would have done so!  Go!!!!
author: Ginger J.

description:
The service was top notch and the food....the food. I can't stop thinking about the caesar salad. The brown butter trout was beyond amazing, all elements perfectly cooked. But, I'm officially obsessed with the caesar salad, which now rivals Zuni's, in my book. It comes with bay shrimp, delicious bread crumbs, and the perfect amount of parsley, which really brightens the flavors. 

Wine and beer are on tap. Prices are a steal for the quality. I'm so excited to see where Red Hill Station goes from here! I'll be back, with my kids, too. (It's family friendly!)
author: Deborah N.

description: As a culinary school graduate, I'm a big skeptic when I go to restaurants. I typically hate spending money making food that I could do better ...haha. But I must say that Red Hill Station was the exception. The food was outstanding! The artichoke stuffed with bay shrimp was perfection . The Caesar salad. .. done everywhere was one f the best I've ever had. The food the chef used showed high quality ingredients and produced a perfect blend off chic yet classic. Plating was beautiful as well. All in all, I would highly recommend this to my friends.
author: Patricia S.

description: My girlfriend and I were looking for some good seafood and we found it! Off the beaten path in bernal heights is this hidden gem. We had the pleasure of sitting at the bar which overlooks the kitchen. It was such a blast to see how they make these delicious meals. We had the oysters, fried anchovies and the cod with mashed potatoes. All dishes were really tasty, and hardy. I highly recommend this place if you are looking for a nice date spot or some good seafood.
author: Taylor H.

description:
Went here for the first time tonight and I plan on coming fairly often. I had a delicious salmon dish with asparagus and fingerling potatoes and my wife had a yummy halibut. We started off with a few oysters each which were all quite good as well. Split a crème brulet and walked out happy.

The space itself is small but gets good light. Brought a 7-month-old baby and the staff was friendly as he babbled. Not a cheap meal (90 bucks after tip) but very good value. All of the ingredients were high quality and they were very-well prepared. Probably the best meal that I've had on Cortland.
author: Ben L.

description:
Excellent food, everything was perfectly cooked and the dishes were well balanced. The staff was wonderful. Everyone was pleasant and accommodating. Our waiter was perfect, there is no other word for it. He appeared when we needed him and I never once thought "it would be nice to have our waiter for X", he gave us time to decide what we wanted, was helpful with the options, picked up on our cues instantly, and didn't feel the need to hover as some otherwise excellent waiters do. 

Overall it was a wonderful experience and I would recommend them to anyone.
author: Caleb S.

description:
Perfectly prepared seafood, big portions, and beyond tasty.  We had fresh oysters, sauteed clams, fries, and trout tartare.  Our waiter was adorable, really sweet, and very attentive.  I honestly can't understand why some of the other reviewers are complaining.  I loved everything about Red Hill Station and it is hands down one of my favorite restaurants in SF.  

Tip: Sit at the bar facing the kitchen - fun views!
author: Stephanie C.

description: Went there on soft opening night . The trout and steak were amazing. Really liked the casual neighborhood vibe. Simple menu makes it easy to order. It's all about the food...quality and good portions! Hope they continue to do great food.
author: Odnit D.

description: Had the pleasure of eating here earlier. Cool little spot, nice ambiance, very cozy. Bathroom was very clean and had fresh towels to dry my hands. Food was great, probably the best cioppino I've ever had. Definitely will be back again
author: Benjamin A.

description: I had the bay shrimp melt, and it was fantastic. The service was amazing. We were lucky to go there during their off hours, when the restaurant isn't too full, because we like to eat early. My friends had the fish tacos. Everyone left without a single complaint. Our waitress was the best. She was attentive to our table and fun and friendly. We will definitely be going back.
author: Shannon P.

description:
I have only been to this restaurant once, on September 5th.  I really wanted to enjoy this relatively new place, that is nearby where I live.  Unfortunately, I was disappointed, especially considering how highly rated it is on Yelp.
The service was so bad, it was hard to appreciate the food.  There are too service errors to list, but here are a few.
New waitress which is OK, but the poor girl had absolutely no support from other staff members.  She could not identify the appetizers from the entrees.  She was unfamiliar with the portion sizes and had no recommendations on the food.  Isn't the service staff supposed to have a pre-dinner sit down and become familiar with the menu?
The appetizers/entrees were staggered when brought out from the kitchen, not presented simultaneously.  Had to sit and watch my partner eat, while waiting for my food to arrive.
When dishes were finished, it took a long time to have the plates cleared.
But, the staff were nice.
Another group that had dinner on the same evening also said the service was severely lacking.
Services lapses happen.  But introducing a new waitress on a Friday night without support?  Mis-communication between the kitchen and servers in such a small place?
Needs work.
author: Reg R.

description: We were really looking forward to trying out this new gem and it exceeded our expectations which were high and hopeful. The oyster menu was amazing, great little wine selection that paired with the menu and so many entrees that sounded delightful. We had the king salmon with stuffed squash blossoms and the gazpacho with bay shrimp. Both were really well plated, sized, and tasty. The desert was a closer for both of us. Highly recommend this charming non pretentious but tasty sea joint.
author: Jessica M.

description: Really yummy! Please don't leave without trying the calamari salad. I'm sitting here thinking about ordering another one, it was that good.
author: Naomi M.

description:
Loved everything about this place.

The food was fantastic, and the staff were warm and welcoming. It felt totally natural to give my server a hug on the way out. Awesome.
author: Vicki H.

description: I have eaten at RHS several times since they opened a couple months ago.  What a great addition to the neighborhood! It is billed as a Seafood restaurant, and the seafood is definitely top notch - so fresh and perfectly seasoned and cooked! But it is so much more!  I have also had a delicious vegan gluten free corn chowder AND and incredibly delicious and oh so warming bison stew. The menu changes daily and it's always exciting to see what's new.
author: Chris S.

description:
Red Hill Station was a great experience from start to finish.  We were a group of 5 and were seated in the Station's very private dining room with a view over the kitchen.  It was the perfect space.  We hadn't reserved it, because we didn't know it existed!

The service was patient and expert every step of the way, including advice on wines.  While the wine and beer list is short, there's good variety to match every dish and taste.

Many of the dishes were unique and amazing.  We all loved the Caesar salad, the calamari salad, grilled sardines, flat iron steak, and wild salmon.  The desserts are fantastic.

Get here before the crowds find it.
author: David B.

description: Everything about the eve was superb  .The reservation was on time , the ambience and the service great and the food unbelievably tasty . The Cesar Salad was perfect  . The Halibut cooked just perfect and with delicious veggies .We will be regulars at this Restaurant .
author: Lewis C.

description: Brown butter Seatrout with toasted almonds was Out of this world - Fantamaglorious! We are so lucky to have this new eatery and brilliant chef in our neighborhood.
author: Banker W.

description:
We really liked this place. Three of us went, thus tripling our tasting opportunities. 

For starters, I had fried anchovies, which must have been fried very hot and very quickly as they were crispy, delicate, and light--oh, and delicious. They were obviously fresh and had come out of the bay--or wherever anchovies live--that morning.  My dining companions had a prosciutto plate and the caesar salad (sans bay shrimp), both of which were very good.  [small note on the caesar: the dressing tends to the lemony and we decided that the shrimp must be the perfect accompaniment. Next time, we'll follow the recommendations of others and get it with the shrimp].

For entrees, we had trout;  fettuccini with clams, spagna beans, and andouille sausage; and bison stew.  All were quite good.  The trout was cooked to perfection and everything on the plate was a delight: the potatoes, which often just fill a plate, were tasty and even the fried sage leaves were more than just a garnish.   The bison stew was the kind of dish that you think about days, even weeks later on those cold-ish foggy nights in winter (or summer) when a stew would be perfect.

The creme brûlée for dessert was very good, but hands-down favorite was the deconstructed hostess cup cake.

Before dining here, I read the 4-5 star reviews and wondered if the ratings were high because the place is new and all the reviewers were probably friends. Whether that's true or not, the reviews are well earned!

In sum, we liked this restaurant.  A lot.  The food is fabulous, the staff is friendly and competent. All-in-all a wonderful dining experience.
author: Diner S.

description: I had dinner with a friend on a weekend evening.  Service was super friendly and helpful.  We opted for the "wine on tap" sangiovese which was good for the price.  Starter was a dozen oysters, which were tasty though a few of them were three-bite monsters which I don't find that enjoyable.  Mains were salmon and calamari, both of which were tasty. The only reason I am not giving 5 stars is for the layout - the tables are really packed in tightly together, and if you have someone in the table next to you who is talking loud (like we did), it can detract from the otherwise great experience.
author: Russ P.

description: Attended the soft opening, oysters+wine, very impressed by the decor and warm atmosphere. Attended the full launch-- sold!  Service is cozy, atmosphere is festive yet intimate.  Great place to celebrate with friends.
author: Obhi H.

description: Very pleased.....! butter oysters, calamari salad, sturgeon fish, and the funnel cake!  YUM!
author: Handan S.

description: Excellent.  Ordered a simple Ceasar salad to feel better about eating fish and chips, and it was the best Ceasars salad I ever had.
author: Mike K.

description: This place is a bit funky, which my wife found charming.  But you're not coming for the atmosphere.  The food is really good.  We are fond of calamari and have tried lots of restaurants and lots of recipes.  The whole squid is fried without batter.  It's spicy and tender and delicious.  The clams with sausage was really good, in fact, judging by everyone's expressions all the food is excellent.
author: FC S.

description: Went here with a few friends for the first time. It's small, but a cute place. The service was good through out our time there. The calamari salad was tasty and the fish and chips were pretty good. I ordered the black cod and my husband ordered the linguine. The black cod was fresh and it melted in my mouth(though I will attribute that to a lot of butter used in the prep:). The linguine on the other hand was mouth watering. The meat balls and the sauce were delicious. The don't have a huge wine selection which would have made the experience even better. But over all a cute, delicious neighborhood restaurant.
author: Chet L.

description: We saw this as a Hot and New place on Yelp and decided to make a reservation for 9 here. A server had called from this restaurant to warn us that the table they had available may not fit 9 as well but we were willing to try for such a large party! We tried most of the menu between all of us and the highlights were the bay shrimp ceasar salad, black cod fish & chips, veggie pasta, and oyster pot pie. The seafood was very fresh and tasty. We ordered 2 dishes of a meat pasta that we were particular fans of - too much garlic got in the way of tasting the overall flavor of the dish. Other than that, the meal was presented well and super fresh. I would definitely return again!
author: Yi-Fang T.

description:
What a wonderful European feel, local, fresh, neighborhood, welcoming.
The food was delicious, my 11 year said "I had never had such a fantastic crab sandwich, can we please go back for my birthday."
Service was impeccable, Taylor and Amy you are doing a amazing job.
It's hard running a restaurant. We will gladly drive up from Half Moon Bay for a night at Red Hill Station
author: joyce o.

description:
a quaint and delicious spot in the adorable neighborhood of bernal heights. the atmosphere is a relaxed beachy vibe that pairs perfectly with a seafood focused menu. i had a robust flat iron steak salad that harnessed flavors of morocco.. my dining partner had a delicately seasoned halibut paired with roasted veggies and smooth mashed potatoes. i enjoyed the sampling of potatoes so much, i had to order a side of my own!

unfortunately we did not save room for dessert but will partake next time. i can't wait to book my next party in the private dining room space that overlooks the kitchen. 

a great, new addition to the neighborhood. i see only great things to come as the menu expands to showcase the best products available to us.
author: CTP p.

description: The place just opened up and has started out with a bang. I had the tuna tartar as an appetizer and the linguine with seafood as an entree and both were stellar.
author: Jean P.

description: My wife and I recently had an excellent dining experience at Red Hill.  First of all the atmosphere was awesome, friendly & intimate.  All dishes were innovative and to die for, particularly the calamari salad, and the hanger steak.  The seafood was "fresh off the boat".  Great service !  Bravo!
author: Mark L.

description: Wow. I am hard-pressed to give away this gem of a restaurant.  When great people serve great food in a great neighborhood, what's not to love? (Only the difficulty getting in I guess!)  Our meal was one we never wanted to end.  Inventive food (gorgeous seafood!) with lovely presentation ... just wonderful!
author: Alexandre P.

description: yum yum yum!!! had the grilled calamari caesar and it was amazing!! there was so much calamari and it was cooked absolutely perfectly. the salad part was whole romain leaves and a warm dressing with crunchy breadcrumbs. loved it so much i came back by myself for just that. so good!!
author: Miss T.

description: My friend and I tried Red Hill Station during our vacation in San Francisco. It's in a quirky little neighborhood way, way off the beaten path for typical San Francisco tourists but it had been recommended to me by a friend. We had a wonderful dinner! Not much to choose from as far as appetizers, but the entrées were wonderful. They seem to change daily. My braised short ribs fell apart at the touch but were so juicy. Desserts to die for. It's A very small place, which lends to the quality of the food and service. The staff was knowledgeable and friendly without being over-the-top. Minor negatives- The wine by the glass seemed a little pricey in comparison to the reasonably priced entrées (they had a small but lovely selection), and I am over mason jar water glasses. Worth the cab fare from Nob Hill!
author: Lisa G.

description: I've been to Redhill Station 3 times.  First time, food was great, but, since they had just opened, the timing was off and the menu was very difficult to read.  But, the food brought us back.  Next two times were really pleasurable.  A big bowl of Mussels, the Caesar salad, and the Pasta Carbonara was all we needed (along with the house Sauvignon Blanc). Amazing!  We'll be back. They're on the way to five stars for sure!
author: Nancy W.

description: Had lunch with friends.  Ordered Caesar with octopus.  The best!  Just enough amount of tang/salt and octopus was so tender.  I recommend this new place to anyone who ask me for a small, intimate and good food restaurant.
author: Leilani I.

description: Very good service, we both liked our food a lot. Good portions, and some interesting dishes. I liked the calamari caesar salad a lot, and my fish was cooked well too. Will definitely go back.
author: Megan B.

description: Hip yet comfortable family friendly local restaurant.  What else can I say?  Flavorful seafood dishes await you.  Wines served in beakers.  Crayons and cards for the youngsters.  Tasty and fresh.  Enjoy people!
author: Average Jo E.

description: Delicious. Fabulous service. Beautiful decor. Wonderful dinner. Great beer on tap, super yummy and fresh oysters, to die for ceasar salad, amazing meaty sardines and tasty root veggies and trout. Would order everything again!!  Can't wait to go back and try other things on the menu. Love the quaint neighborhood feel!
author: Lisa C.

description:
This restaurant is outstanding. The food is amazing!!! They delivered warm olives as soon as I sat down. I had the red trout cooked perfectly, topped with a sage butter and walnuts. Yum! Accompanied by asparagus, crooked neck squash, beets and roasted potatoes. The Oysters are the freshest in SAn Francisco. It was all gluten free (I have celiac). They really understood my food allergy and made it so easy to order. I will be back many times. Service is great too.
I could eat here everyday. Next time I will have the grilled calamari salad and steak with beets and masked potatoes. Or maybe I will have the clams, muscles and sausage.
author: Daune F.

description:
love the sardine salad for lunch -
substantial & tasty.
the service there is also a cut above -
would definitely go back.
author: Kim Y.

description: Took my visiting mom here, along with my two very young kids. They had coloring books for the kids and sat us in a private room overlooking the kitchen. Very good food. We came for an early dinner without reservations and didn't have to wait at all.
author: Leigh C.

description: Delicious late lunch! Had great assortment of very fresh oysters; a must if you love oysters. Generous portion of cod, perfectly prepared--enjoyed every tender, flavorful bite. My friend had the whole Dungeness crab, a large crab served in sublime broth. Service was attentive. Classic, welcoming SF neighborhood feel with custom touches, including beautifully carved benches. Looking forward to returning.
author: Kelly E.

description: A friend recommended this place for a special dinner to celebrate our anniversary.  We were very happy with the recommendation.  The food was very good, the menu unique, the atmosphere unpretentious, and the service friendly.  We had a really enjoyable dinner and now we can recommend this place too.
author: N M.

description:
Sunday evening family dinner; 2 adults-2 kids(6yrs.) and no reservation. 
I would recommend calling for a reservation, although our wait was minimal and the staff was very hospitable while we waited, it's a very busy place.  
Dinner selections: (they mentioned the menu changes nightly)
Anchovy app.
Fish and Chips
Pot Pie
Sand Dabs
both Desserts

EVERY bite of every dish was amazing!!!  Fresh, flavorful, balanced, beautifully  presented and nice size portions.  All the staff were smiling, kind and everything came out in a timely manner.

The details of the decor and serving dishes won my heart!!! Copper,wood and marble with a warm eclectic finish, well done!!!

CONGRATULATIONS  and welcome to the neighborhood!!!!  Can't wait to return soon.
author: Kate T.

description:
I went in there around 9:30 on a Saturday night after having heard from a friend that this new restaurant was worth checking out.  The restaurant was about half full, although the waitress told us that it had been packed most of the evening.  We started off with a dozen oysters and a couple of glasses of Sauvignon Blanc.  The oysters were delicious, which was not surprising given that this place advertises as an oyster bar, but the wine was also quite good.  It came out of a tap (which I have not seen very often) and was crisp and well structured - obviously selected by someone who knew about quality wines.

My boyfriend and I shared the black cod, which was baked and sprinkled with toasted almonds and crispy sage leaves.  The cod was probably the best cod I have ever had: buttery and tender, yet still firm, and the sage and almonds added a lovely delicate flavor.  It also came with a grilled white peach, which is in season right now and very sweet.  Sides included roast potatoes and squash. The dish was generous in portion and quite reasonably priced for the quality.  

The chef/owner (who is a handsome Sicilian man who used to cook at Anchor Oyster Bar) came out and chatted with us for a while, since we wound up being the last customers in the restaurant.  He was quite funny and warm, and made us feel well taken care of.  He told us about the process of fixing up the restaurant and it sounded like quite a barn-raising - the previous owners had left it in shambles so they pulled together a big team of friends to help clean and remodel it on a shoe-string budget!     

This restaurant has just opened up and has apparently generated quite a buzz already.  I'd recommend making reservations in advance, although they do have tables reserved for walk-in.
author: Meg S.

description:
Two friends and I had snacks here this evening. We were not terribly impressed. Very limited wine and beer selection. The wines weren't necessarily the best matches for seafood, especially oysters. 
The oyster selection was decent - 4 types. Amply chilled. $2.50 a piece is good compared to some other spots in SF. We split a dozen and were aiiight on the oysters. 
The fried anchovies were perfectly battered and salted. Small portion. Pesto was way too oily and too much for the fish. The dish was garnished with butter lettuce. 
Calamari salad.  Calamari was overcooked. Slim portion. The supporting salad players were tasty. The salad contained butter leaf lettuce which ended-up being a theme in 3 of our dishes. 
The clam crudo and fritter. Butter lettuce! The fritter component was good - the raw clams - they were overly cured or something. Too chewy. 
I was Ok with the casual decor but the prices were far from casual. Pretty spendy for small portions and subpar fare. 
Service was awkward. 
I might go back - just for oysters and some wine on tap. Try some other stuff after they get their sea legs. 
We opted not to try other dishes and went elsewhere for part deux of dinner.....
author: Carson R.

description:
It really pains me to write a negative review for this place, since it was some of the best seafood I have ever had, but that's exactly why I feel this review carries so much weight - the owners need to know how abysmal my service was last night so that they can fix it and have a successful business in the ever competitive San Francisco food scene.
Shall we begin?
The night started with me arriving for my reservation. I told waitress 1 (shorter, medium length hair) my name and that I had a reservation for 2. She walks off to check, and doesn't reappear. A bit later, after seeing me just standing around, waitress 2 (taller, younger, very short hair) asks if I have a reservation, I say yes, and she promptly seats my girlfriend and I. Why waitress 1 didn't do that and where she went is beyond me. 
Next we sit down and place a bottle of wine I had brought on the table. Waitress 1 comes by, asks if we wanted the bottle opened - I said yes - then takes the bottle and disappears into the back. This is a huge faux pas. Now I don't need a song and dance with cork smelling and the sort, but you never ever take someone's bottle out of sight, then return with it opened. She could have done literally anything to it (the big concern is she pours it out, then refills the bottle with something else - that's why it is such poor etiquette to take the bottle out of sight like that). The wine tasted how it was supposed to (ie not doctored), but it's still should not have been done.
We place our orders all at once, oysters, app, 2 entres and eagerly wait for our food - the entire menu sounded great! 
First to arrive was the anchovies, the dish is a grill so they were cooked. I don't know who messed up the timing, the kitchen or the waitress, but you shouldn't serve a cooked dish (or really any dish) before oysters. It just didn't make sense. Then, when we were still eating the anchovies, she arrived with our oysters. This crowded out table and made us rush through the anchovies. She could have waited until we had finished one dish, before bringing out the next. 
Later my calamari arrived, but our table hadn't been bussed so waitress 1 took our side plates and utensils to bring out clean ones. So I had my calamari sitting in front of me with no way to eat it. It was actually kind-of comical. Later she returns and gives me a fork and a knife and my girlfriend just a fork. I had calamari she ordered cod. If anything the lone knife should've been given to her. 
We then sat waiting for the second dish - I don't like to eat before the whole party gets their food. We waited about 5 mins before jointly deciding that my food was getting cold. Then we started to share my dish when waitress 1 promises that the cod is on it's way. We stop sharing and continue to wait. Probably another 10 mins went by and my girlfriend insisted I eat. I did, the food was completely cold by that point. Around the time I finished my dish the cod arrived.
I sat politely and waited while my girlfriend ate her dish (a very odd situation, hard to make conversation while someone's eating and I had nothing to eat myself). Waitress 1 comes over and apologizes saying the cod is on the house. She then asked if we wanted dessert, and when I say everything on the menu looked good I mean everything including all the desserts, but we declined because we were positive it would be screwed up in some way. 
Waitress 1 brings our check and takes a card. She then returns later with a receipt sleeve. We open it to find just one receipt. No card, no signable receipt. We both just started laughing. It was almost like we were being punk'd or something. Waitress 2 later arrives with the card and we sign and go.
Red hill really needs to work on its timing. The food was stellar, and I would like to one day return, but so many things went wrong. Please fix - the only reason this isn't a 1 star review is due to the quality of the food and the fact that they comped a dish.
author: Philip B.

description: I've been a fan of Chef Taylor for years and when I heard he was opening his own restaurant I was super excited.   It was the second night the restaurant was open and it was buzzing!   The decor of the restaurant was cozy and warm and the staff very friendly.   For a restaurant newly opened the front of house staff was efficient, friendly, and very accomodating.    I had the Ceasar Salad and the halibut with tarragon, asparagus, shiitake mushrooms with fingerling potatoes and walnuts.     The Ceasar was yummy as other reviews have stated.   Chef Taylor use vegetables very nicely in his dishes.  The halibut was perfectly cooked and the walnuts added a nice texture to the dish.   I live in Santa Monica and visit SF from time to time and look forward to coming back next time I am in town! Big 5 star review!!   If you live in Bernal you are lucky!  If you aren't in Bernal, now you have one more reason to visit this cool neighborhood!  Check it out!
author: Jonathan C.

description: This place is amazing, great food matched with fantastic service.  I am not a fan of long winded reviews so I will keep it short - try this place now before it becomes the next NOPA
author: Ryan S.

description: It is a great little place and unexpectedly good too, yet not terribly exciting. I'd definitely return to try a few more items from the menu.
author: Mehmet G.

description: Wow what a treat!  We were strolling along Cortland Ave. deciding where to eat when we walked by this gem!  Saw the fish stew on the menu and I was sold. I was not disappointed either. My wife and I ordered the fish stew, fried smelt, and a side of french fries.  We were so amazed with the depth of the flavors of our dishes that we couldn't stop talking about it when we got home.  Prices are reasonable, our waitress was super awesome, service was super attentive, cute little restaurant, wine list was good with generous pour, and most importantly the FOOD!  We most definitely will be coming here again!
author: Kristin C.

description: Celebrated a graduation lunch there last month - May. We were a party of 9 and was placed in their separate dining area. We got to the restaurant a little earlier than the reserved time and were comfortably showed to our seating area. The food was delicious - ceviche appetizer, seafood pasta, fish & chips,  and crunchy fried pickles, to name some of what we ordered. They provided us with tastes of the beverages, we were contemplating on ordering. We never felt rushed and the serving staff, checked back with us enough, to make the whole lunch experience there super enjoyable. We had a GREAT TIME!!
author: LaFlor B.

description: We shared the fried sardines & had the lamb chops & a carbonara & also shared a pot-de-crème for dessert. Everything was delicious. The waiter was pleasant & helpful. Can't wait to return!
author: Jorge Y.

description: What a wonderful place!  Would love to have quality, reasonably priced dining like this in close proximity to my neighborhood.  The waitstaff was friendly and pleasant and knowledgable but did not "hover" or try to speed you up.  The food was outrageous good, and portions more than adequate.  And why pay big name prices at the big name places when you can eat here - better food, smaller price.  Go and enjoy.
author: Jay C.

description: Congrats Amy and Taylor! The place is fantastic and the food is phenomenal!  We will definitely be back for more!!!!!
author: Adonica W.

description:
I had a really nice Valentine dinner at the Red Hill Station... I was a little nervous going there since some people complained on the Yelp bible ;) of not enough seafood in cioppino and too much noise in the room etc... but I ended up pleasantly surprised... It wasn't noisy at all; we were able to have an intimate conversation, lots of elbow space and the decor was charming without trying too hard. If I ever had any doubts about oysters, I have made my mind that night... I love them; good oysters really transport you to the beach and it is like having ocean in your mouth... in a good way ;)
I had a trout for the main course and even though it was a relatively a simple rustic dish, I must admit it was delicious... you can't go wrong with sage pecan butter, you simply can't... 
My husband was a little less excited about his carbonara; he complained it had too much bacon in it... he left half of the bacon on the plate... it was a heavy dose of bacon, that's for sure... I guess there is such a thing as too much of a good thing ;)
The bread, olive oil and balsamic, olives were all delicious. So was the desert: lace cookies with berries and whipped cream... simple but oh, so tasty... a big portion as well... :)
I was very happy with my wine as well: a delicate French white...unfortunately half way through it, I ended up knocking my glass over and breaking it... :9  ...the waiter was very gracious about the clean up... he brought me another glass but at the end of the night my husband did get charged for it... it was a $15 glass of wine and even though I admit it was my fault, I hoped it would not show up on our bill... I did some research on it when I came home and it seems that opinions are split, even though most restaurant owners seem to believe that a good restaurant will absorb the breakage cost... It isn't really about the money but I feel it would be a nice gesture if it had been on the house. 
Either way, I will be back for the oysters and another glass of that overpriced French white ;)
author: ania w.

description: We had a lovely prix-fixe Valentine's Day meal last night. The food was delicious and the service was also very good. We opted for wine pairings and we delighted with the expert doing the pouring as well as the wines. The portions were generous. The only downfall was that the desserts were not up to the level of the rest of the meal, with too much alcohol in the zabaglione and a tough density to the creme brûlée. We will be back, however, and look forward to trying out the regular menu.
author: Rachele F.

description: ummm, where to start? red hill station is such a great addition to the neighborhood. the staff is kind, on it and super accommodating. the chef will always make a special vegan meal request. every time i eat here, IT IS DELICIOUS. all my family and friends LOVE the seafood. the servings are generous, the food is underpriced and the quality is clearly excellent. can you tell i'm a fan...?

description: Amazing.  Delicious, heartbreakingly good food. Beautiful presentation. Warm, neighborhood vibe. Exquisite seafood. Superb oysters. And awesome desserts! There is magic here.
author: Jolie S.

description: The seafood was so fresh. The service was excellent and the ambience was great. The crab was devine.
author: Mark C.

description: This place is fabulous. The ambiance is great, I loved our waiter, very nice and his suggestions were spot on. Wine was very good. I had the oysters, AMAZING, mussels  were delicious and so the was shrimp Caesar. Will be back!
author: Claire R.

description: Caesar salad with bay shrimp is one of the best I've ever had. Here's a tip- ask for the dressing on the side. It allows you to see how gorgeous it is! It's so good you'll want to keep it for dipping. Grilled calamari with figs was scrumptious although they could put less dressing on the greens. Trout with almonds was perfectly cooked and served with seasonal vegetables and brown butter sauce. Oysters were served beautifully in what looked like a very large vintage french tureen. Bread is wonderful- be sure to ask for it as it is served with a small bowl of olives in what tasted like a olive oil, chopped garlic, and red pepper mix. Didn't stay for dessert because I'm not a fan of Mission Pie but I know others love it. So glad Red Hill is finally here! Also, don't hesitate to take your vegan or vegetarian friends here- they have a pasta and vegan option!
author: Micah S.

description: Excellent food, super nice owners. Great addition to the neighborhood. Make sure to get the pot de creme!
author: Milodaman Z.
